metadata.title: CVE-2020-27786 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s implementation of MIDI, where anattacker with a local account and the permissions to issue ioctl commandsto midi devices could trigger a use-after-free issue. A write to thisspecific memory while freed and before use causes the flow of execution tochange and possibly allow for memory corruption or privilege escalation.The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality,integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-40-generic - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-5.4.0-40-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-40-generic - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-40-lowlatency - 5.4.0-40.44
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-40.44').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18').

linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1013.13').
